Title: Constructor could overflow in initialization of totalÂ supply
Content:
The `ElementToken` [constructor](https://github.com/element-group/element-erc20-smart-contract/blob/6a7b48cec1aa8a823b7ec4a03adadc5ca9d22e29/contracts/ElementToken.sol#L34) does not perform any precondition checks on the [tokens](https://github.com/element-group/element-erc20-smart-contract/blob/6a7b48cec1aa8a823b7ec4a03adadc5ca9d22e29/contracts/ElementToken.sol#L34) argument. Based on how [totalSupply](https://github.com/element-group/element-erc20-smart-contract/blob/6a7b48cec1aa8a823b7ec4a03adadc5ca9d22e29/contracts/ElementToken.sol#L38) is being calculated, this could result in an overflow in the calculation of [totalSupply](https://github.com/element-group/element-erc20-smart-contract/blob/6a7b48cec1aa8a823b7ec4a03adadc5ca9d22e29/contracts/ElementToken.sol#L38), setting an invalid total supply of tokens.


Consider using the OpenZeppelin [SafeMath](https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/zeppelin-solidity/blob/v1.4.0/contracts/math/SafeMath.sol) library to calculate the [totalSupply](https://github.com/element-group/element-erc20-smart-contract/blob/6a7b48cec1aa8a823b7ec4a03adadc5ca9d22e29/contracts/ElementToken.sol#L38), or performing a precondition check to prevent an overflow.
